column4: hi: I am trying to delete a partition from ubuntu, and I can't see it via gparted or df -h. Any ideas for how to find it / delete it?
hmm.. gparted doesn't usually miss partitions... you sure it's not there? you've looked at the right hard drive?
I'm sure. I made the partition in Windows XP -- I don't know if somehow that would be invisible to ubuntu?
I doubt it.. if you boot into windows can you see the partition there?
can you create a screenshot with the gparted window?
I can't boot into Windows anymore, hence wanting to delete it.

I'll try. I wanted to delete the windows partition cause I'm out of space on my ubuntu partition ... and it's tricky right now to make room! Should be able to figure this out, but it may be a few min.
ok.. so you've got one hard drive.. 37 GB? odd size... ntfs ... /boot /host? are you running wubi?
I did install ubuntu via wubi from XP.
just me talking to myself =)  .. I have no idea how wubi does it's thing or if it's even possible to remove the windows partition that you used for the wubi install
Ah! =). Mmm. Yeah ... strange it doesn't show up, eh?
I'm not sure how wubi does it's think but it looks like it's running in some kind of virtual space.. ie it doesn't see the real hardware
Ah! wubi's faq says that ubuntu is installed within a file on windows.
yup.. that sounds like what I've heard
I can't really help you any further with this as I have to get to bed. Ask the channel again
